column4: question: http://paste.ubuntu.com/667426/  why is the 'x' bit not included even though it's included in umask?
There is no root password, the root account is locked.  Use sudo to do things as root. See https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RootSudo
thanks.  I guess files don't really need the +x bit in a file share anyways?  Only the directories need +x so that users can 'ls' them?
yeah, sorry that link wasn't for you.. but only directories need +x unless you really need for the files to be executable (which they don't normally need)
